intro: Pentzia woodii, commonly known as the Cape chestnut, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain edible seeds, which have been traditionally used by indigenous communities. Pentzia woodii is typically found in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air. Its ecological importance lies in its role as a food source for various wildlife species.
